page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: THIS UNDULATING AREA TAKES IN THE VILLAGES OF GOLDSITHNEY,ST.HILARY, PLAIN AN GWARRY (PLAYING PLACE) AND THE EASTERN HALF OF MARAZION. THE REMAINDER IS MOSTLY FARMLAND WITH OCCASIONAL HABITATIONS. THE MAJOR LAND OWNER IS LORD ST.LEVAN, WHOSE HOME FARM IS TREVARTHIAN AT PLAIN AN GWARRY. THE AREA IS POPULAR WITH TOURISTS AS LANDS END, ST.MICHAELS MOUNT AND MANY FINE BEACHES ARE WITHIN EASY REACH. OLD ENGINE HOUSES AND CHIMNEYS OF THE COPPER AND TIN MINES CAN BE SEEN AND SPOIL TIPS AND FENCED OPEN SHAFTS DOT THE AREA. THERE IS ABUNDANT WILD LIFE, PARTICULARLY BIRDS AS THE PENINSULA IS ON THE MIGRATORY ROUTE OF MANY SPECIES.
